subject: PE Today: Dobbs Joins The "Family"
body:
CBSNews.com













Lou 
      Dobbs Debuts As "Newest Member Of Early Show Family""Take 
      Lou" is labeled as "commentary," and it certainly is that.  Dobbs says "we cannot reform our immigration 
      laws if we cannot control immigration. And we can't control immigration 
      until we secure our borders and our ports. It is that simple, and it is 
      that difficult." Dobbs' strong association with the immigration issue raises the question: 
      Should someone on the other side be offered a platform to respond?[+ Read More]



ImessOne 
      thing that has struck me about coverage of the Imus affair is the fact 
      that media outlets, including the "Evening News," have had no problem 
      repeating what Imus said. I'm all for that – his words are a central part 
      of the story, and simply writing that Imus made derogatory remarks, 
      without specifying what they were, doesn't give news consumers all the 
      information. But there does seem to be a double standard here...[+ Read More]



"Couric 
      & Co." Blog Apologizes For "Omission" Last night, an 
      Editor's Note was posted on the 
      "Couric & Co." blog 
      apologizing for the similarities between an installment 
      of "Katie Couric's Notebook" and a piece in the Wall Street Journal. The April 
      4 Notebook has now been removed from the site. Mike Sims, director 
      of News and Operations for CBSNews.com, declined to comment about the 
      specifics of the matter. "The Editor's Note speaks for itself," said Sims.[+ Read More]
